page.title: 13The Harbour
page.content: The southern end of Yarmouth port lies within this survey area. The present entrance dates from the early 17th century, a cut being made here across the long sand spit extended to Corton. The present south side of the right angled entrance is Gorleston Pier on which stands the coastguard station. The tidal range is only 1.8 metres in the harbour which allows ships to enter at most states of the tide, but the minimum depth being only 4.3 metres restricts the tonnage of vessels to about 4000, with a length of 50 metres. Navigating the entrance at Brush Bend is difficult, so pilots must assist unless the ship's captain is experienced. Captains of the North Sea Ferries pilot them in themselves.
